channel.title: Loading, Saving, Converting and Managing on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Loading, Saving, Converting and Managing on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Different Ways to Open Files
item.description: With Aspose.Cells it is possible to open files, for example, to retrieve data, or to use a designer template to speed up the development process. Contents Summary 1 Opening a File via a Path 2 Opening a File using a Stream 3 Opening a File with Data only 4 Loading Visible Sheets only | Opening a File via a Path Developers can open a Microsoft Excel file using its file path on the local computer by specifying it in the Workbook class constructor.

item.title: Opening Different Microsoft Excel Versions Files
item.description: Aspose.Cells can open a range of different Microsoft Excel Versions Files, such as Microsoft Excel 95/97 - 2003, SpreadsheetML, Opening Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 XLSX or Encrypted Excel Files. Contents Summary 1 Opening Files of Different Microsoft Excel Versions 1.1 Opening Microsoft Excel 95/5.0 Files 1.2 Opening Microsoft Excel 97 - 2003 Files 1.3 Opening Microsoft Excel 2007/2010 XLSX Files 1.4 Opening Encrypted Excel Files 1.5 Unsupported Excel formats

item.title: Opening Files with Different Formats
item.description: Using Aspose.Cells you can open files with different formats. Aspose.Cells can open a range of file formats such as Microsoft Excel spreadsheets (XLS, XLSX, XLSM, XLSB), SpreadsheetML, Comma-separated values (CSV), Tab Delimited or Tab-separated values (TSV) files etc. Contents Summary 1 Opening Files with Different Formats 1.1 Opening SpreadsheetML Files 1.2 Opening HTML Files 1.3 Opening CSV Files 1.3.1 Opening CSV files and replacing invalid characters 1.3.2 Using preferred parser

item.title: Different Ways to Save Files
item.description: Aspose.Cells makes it possible to create and save files. This article explains the various ways in which files can be saved. Contents Summary 1 Different Ways to Save Files 2 Saving File to Some Location 3 Saving Workbook to Text or CSV Format 4 Saving Text Files with Custom Separator 5 Saving File to a Stream | Different Ways to Save Files Aspose.

item.title: Saving File to Response Object
item.description: Aspose.Cells makes it possible to manipulate files. This article explains the various ways in which files can be saved to a response object. Contents Summary 1 Saving File to Response Object 1.1 XLS Files 1.2 XLSX Files 1.3 PDF Files | Saving File to Response Object It is also possible to generate a file dynamically and send it directly to a client browser.

item.title: Convert Workbook to Different Formats
item.description: Aspose.Cells supports conversion between many formats. Technically, conversion means to load a workbook in one file format and save it into another. Contents Summary 1 Converting Excel Workbook to XPS 2 Converting Excel Workbook to MHTML Files 3 Converting Excel Workbook to HTML 4 Setting the Image Preferences for HTML 5 Convert Excel Workbook to Markdown | Converting Excel Workbook to XPS The XPS document format consists of structured XML markup that defines the layout of a document and the visual appearance of each page, along with rendering rules for distributing, archiving, rendering, processing and printing documents.

item.title: Convert Excel Workbook to PDF
item.description: Aspose.Cells supports conversion of Excel Workbook into PDF. In this example, we will see the complete conversion of an Excel Workbook into PDF. Contents Summary 1 Converting Excel Workbook to PDF 1.1 Direct Conversion 1.2 Advanced Conversion 1.2.1 Saving Workbook to PDF/A Complied Files 1.2.2 Set the PDF Creation Time 1.2.3 Set ContentCopyForAccessibility option 1.2.4 Export Custom properties to PDF 1.3 Conversion Attributes | Converting Excel Workbook to PDF PDF files are widely used to exchange documents between organizations, government sectors, and individuals.

item.title: Converting Worksheet to Different Image Formats
item.description: Aspose.Cells allows you to export a worksheet from the workbook and convert it into different formats. This article explains how to convert a worksheet to different formats. Contents Summary 1 Converting Worksheet to Image 2 Converting Worksheet to SVG | Converting Worksheet to Image Worksheets contain data that you want to analyze. For example, a worksheet can contain parameters, totals, percentages, exceptions, and calculations.

item.title: Encrypting Excel Files
item.description: Microsoft Excel (97 - 2007) enables you to encrypt and password protect your spreadsheets. It uses algorithms provided by a cryptographic service provider, or CSP, a set of cryptographic algorithms with different properties. The default CSP is ‘Office 97/2000 Compatible’ or ‘Weak Encryption (XOR)'. It’s important to choose the proper encryption key length. Some CSPs don’t support more than 40 or 56 bits. That’s considered to be weak encryption. For strong encryption, a minimum key length of 128 bits is required.

item.title: Trim Leading Blank Rows and Columns while exporting spreadsheets to CSV format
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Trim Leading Blank Rows and Columns while exporting spreadsheets to CSV format 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes, your Excel or CSV file has leading blank columns or rows. For example, consider this line ,,,data1,data2 Here the first three cells or columns are blank. When you open such a CSV file in Microsoft Excel, then Microsoft Excel discards these leading blank rows and columns.

item.title: Get Warnings while Loading Excel File
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Get Warnings while Loading Excel File 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes the user tries to load the workbook which is somewhat corrupt but loadable. In such case, Aspose.Cells throws warnings while loading the workbook. You can catch these warnings by implementing the IWarningCallback interface and setting LoadOptions.

item.title: AutoFit Columns and Rows while loading HTML in Workbook
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 AutoFit Columns and Rows while loading HTML in Workbook 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can autofit columns and rows while loading your HTML file inside the Workbook object. Please set the HtmlLoadOptions.AutoFitColsAndRows property to **true **for this purpose. AutoFit Columns and Rows while loading HTML in Workbook The following sample code first loads the sample HTML into Workbook without any load options and saves it in XLSX format.

item.title: Convert Excel file to PDF format compatible with PDFA-1a
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Convert Excel file to PDF format compatible with PDFA-1a 3 Screenshot 4 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios PDF/A is a unique flavor of PDF designed for the long-term preservation of documents. PDF/A is an ISO-standardized version of the Portable Document Format (PDF) which is an archival format of PDF that embeds all fonts used in the document within the PDF file.

item.title: Read Numbers Spreadsheet Developed by Apple Inc. using Aspose.Cells
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Read Numbers Spreadsheet Developed by Apple Inc. using Aspose.Cells 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Numbers is a spreadsheet application developed by Apple Inc. Aspose.Cells can read Numbers spreadsheet but it does not support writing to it. It can read Numbers spreadsheet’s Data, Style and Formulas. Read Numbers Spreadsheet Developed by Apple Inc.

item.title: Save Workbook to Strict Open XML Spreadsheet Format
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Save Workbook to Strict Open XML Spreadsheet Format 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios Aspose.Cells allows you to save the workbook in Strict Open XML Spreadsheet format. For that purpose, it provides the Workbook.Settings.Compliance property. If you set its value as OoxmlCompliance.Iso29500_2008_Strict, then the output Excel file will be saved in Strict Open XML Spreadsheet format.

item.title: Keep Separators for Blank Rows while exporting spreadsheets to CSV format
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Keep Separators for Blank Rows while exporting spreadsheets to CSV format 2 Sample Code | Keep Separators for Blank Rows while exporting spreadsheets to CSV format Aspose.Cells provides the ability to keep line separators while converting spreadsheets to CSV format. For this, You may use the KeepSeparatorsForBlankRow property of TxtSaveOptions class. KeepSeparatorsForBlankRow is a boolean property.

item.title: Track Document Conversion Progress
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Track Document Conversion Progress 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes converting large excel files can take some time. During this time, you might want to show the document conversion progress instead of just a loading screen to enhance the usability of your application. Aspose.Cells supports tracking document conversion process by providing the IPageSavingCallback interface.

item.title: Adjust workbook compression level
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Adjust workbook compression level | Adjust workbook compression level Developers can adjust the compression level of the workbook when working with larger workbooks. Developers may prioritize smaller file sizes over processing time or vice versa. Aspose.Cells provides OoxmlCompressionType enumeration which you can use to set the compression level of the workbook. The OoxmlCompressionType enumeration provides the following members.

item.title: Track Conversion Progress of Excel to TIFF
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Track Conversion Progress of Excel to TIFF 3 Sample Code 4 Console Output | Possible Usage Scenarios Sometimes converting large excel files can take some time. During this time, you might want to show the document conversion progress instead of just a loading screen to enhance the usability of your application. Aspose.

item.title: Convert Excel to HTML with tooltip
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Convert Excel to HTML with tooltip | Convert Excel to HTML with tooltip There might be cases where the text is cut off in the generated HTML and you want to display the complete text as a tooltip on the hover event. Aspose.Cells supports this by providing HtmlSaveOptions.AddTooltipText property. Setting the HtmlSaveOptions.AddTooltipText property to true will add the complete text as a tooltip in the generated HTML.

item.title: Convert JSON to CSV
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Convert JSON to CSV | Convert JSON to CSV Aspose.Cells supports converting simple as well as nested JSON to CSV. For this, the API provides JsonLayoutOptions and JsonUtility classes. The JsonLayoutOptions class provides the options for JSON layout like IgnoreArrayTitle(ignores the title if the array is a property of an object) or ArrayAsTable(processes the array as a table).

item.title: Convert CSV to JSON
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Convert CSV to JSON 1.1 Sample Code 1.2 Console Output | Convert CSV to JSON Aspose.Cells supports converting CSV to JSON. For this, the API provides ExportRangeToJsonOptions and JsonUtility classes. The ExportRangeToJsonOptions class provides the options for exporting range to JSON. The ExportRangeToJsonOptions class has the following properties. ExportAsString: This exports the string value of the cells to JSON.
